Outreach Activities

Explore our upcoming and past outreach activities that celebrate India's rich mathematical heritage through conferences, workshops, and lectures.

Announcing: Ganita Sammelan

19-22 January 2025

This in-person four-day workshop will have a rich variety of events: plenary talks by distinguished scholars (including Prof Manjul Bhargava, Dr MD Srinivas, Prof MS Sriram, Prof K Ramasubramanian, Prof Amartya K Dutta), presentations by other scholars, release of at least two major new books, a session in remembrance of the towering scholar, the late Prof RC Gupta, results of a national quiz competition for schoolchildren on the history of Indian mathematics, interactive sessions with school students (including fun and games), etc.

Download Poster Register for the event Book of Abstracts Schedule

Past Outreach Activities

Workshop for School Teachers: An Introduction to Mathematics in India

12-14 February 2024

A practical exploration of India's rich mathematical heritage! This workshop combined historical insights, hands-on activities, and interactive talks to provide educators with a deep understanding of Indian mathematics.

Download Poster

INFINITE INSIGHTS: A journey through India's mathematical marvels

16-17 November 2023

This conversation series was a platform open to all and discussed the convergence of the past and present in exploring India's knowledge systems.

Download Poster

Young Scholars' Conference on the History of Mathematics

21 January 2023

In this second instalment of the Young Scholars' Conference conducted online, researchers discussed a variety of topics related to Indian Mathematics.

Schedule Book of Abstracts
Photos of Workshop

Apodictic Discourse: A Paradigm for Rational Scholarly Communication?

17 September 2021

In this online seminar, the speaker provided the paradigm for communication among scholars to emancipate the dimensions of scientific knowledge.

Download Poster

How International Were the Early International Congresses of Mathematicians?

18 June 2021

In this online seminar, the speaker discussed the early history of the International Congresses of Mathematicians, and how they gradually opened up to the wider world.

Download Poster

Young Scholars' Conference on the History of Mathematics

17 & 18 April 2021

In this two-day online conference, young researchers from around the world presented their research on various themes of ancient Mathematics, with special emphasis on India. The originality of the conference was that several senior scholars in the field commented on the young scholars' presentations and offered further advice.

Schedule Book of Abstracts
Photos of Workshop

International Conference on Exploring the History of Indian Mathematics

4-6 December 2017

This international conference at IIT Gandhinagar, jointly held with the Indian Society for the History of Mathematics, hosted some of the finest scholars in the field from India and overseas, and discussed India's advances in ancient to twentieth-century Indian mathematics.

Schedule Book of Abstracts
Photos of Workshop

Workshop on Promoting History of Science in India

16–17 March 2013

This workshop presented an authentic picture of scientific advances in pre-modern India, especially in the fields of mathematics and astronomy. Leading scholars and over 50 delegates engaged in discussions on how to promote awareness of ancient India's achievements in science.

Schedule Book of Abstracts
Photos of Workshop
